lines.content: * This is an abstract class for all Commands used in the chatbot.
* @param taskList TaskList handles the tasks list.
* @param storageManager Storage manager handling storing & deletion of tasks.
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, StorageManager storageManager);
* Returns the exit status of the command.
* This class encapsulates Command Parser which parses commands.
* @throws IrwynException If the input is an invalid command.

* This class encapsulates the class DeadlineCommand.

* If the date format is invalid, it will display an error message.

* @param storageManager Storage manager handles storing & deleting of tasks.

ui.reply("Invalid date format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format.\n");
* This class encapsulates the class DeleteCommand.

* This class encapsulates the class FindCommand.

+ "use /by (date/time) for deadlines or use /from (date/time) and /to (date/time) for events\n"

* @param msg The message that details the input exception.

* Java coding standards is followed throughout the code.

* Instantiates a TaskManager object, Ui object, and a StorageManager Object.
* This class encapsulates the Deadline class.
* @param description The description of the deadline.
* @param by The end date and time of the deadline.
* This method converts a string into a LocalDateTime object.
* If the string is in the format "yyyy-MM-dd", it will be treated as a date at the start of the day.
* If the string is in the format "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss", it will be treated as a date with time.
* Otherwise, the string is expected to be in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss".
* @param dateTime The string to be converted into a LocalDateTime object.
* @return A LocalDateTime object that represents the date and time specified by the input string.
* This class encapsulates the Event class.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param start The start of the event.
* @param end The end of the event.
public Event (String description, String start, String end) {
* This class encapsulates the Task class.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param taskType The task type of the task.
* Marks the task to be done.
* Unmarks the task to be not done.
* This method returns the status icon of the task.
* If the task is done, it returns "X", otherwise it returns " ".
* @return A string that represents the status icon of the task.
* This method returns the file format of the task.
* If the task is done, it returns "1", otherwise it returns "0".
* The description of the task is appended after " | ".
* @return A string that represents the file format of the task.
* This method returns the string representation of the task.
* The status icon and the description of the task are included in the string.
* @return A string that represents the task.
* This method returns a string that acknowledges the addition of the task.
* It includes the task, and the total number of tasks in the list.
* @param numberList The total number of tasks in the list.
* @return A string that acknowledges the addition of the task.
return "Got it. I've added this task:\n  "
+ "Now you have " + numberList + " tasks in the list.\n";
* This class encapsulates the TaskList class.
* It represents a TaskList to handle task operations.
* This method converts a string into a Task object.
* The string is expected to be in a specific format, with parts separated by " | ".
* Depending on the first part of the string, a different type of Task object is created.
* If the second part of the string is "1", the task is marked as done.
* @param data The string to be converted into a Task object.
* @return A Task object that represents the task specified by the input string. Returns null if the task type is not recognized.
Task event = new Event(parts[2], parts[3], parts[4]);
